TEXT.TITLE: INDIA DETAILS RAIN/FLOOD DAMAGE TO GRAIN IN 1986
TEXT.BODY: Rain and floods in India last year damaged about 69,000 tonnes of grain intended for human consumption during storage and transportation, food and civil supplies minister H. K. L. Bhagat told Parliament. He did not give comparative figures and said the government-owned Food Corporation of India (FCI) had not yet decided whether these grains could be used as cattle feed. Bhagat said the FCI had a total of 16.43 mln tonnes of food grains in its warehouses at the end of 1986. It had asked state governments to build more warehouses to avoid damage to grains. REUTER
